qas.question: When did the Qing dynasty begin to rule in Tibet?
When did Amdo come under Qing control?
When was Kham incorporated into neighboring Chinese provinces?
Who restored the Dalai Lama as a ruler?
What was the governing councel called?
What dynasty began their rule in 1702?
What came under Qing control in 1742?

plausible_answers.text: was incorporated into neighbouring Chinese provinces

qas.question: What happened to eastern Kham in 1782?
How were the Ambans living in Lhasa killed in 1705?

plausible_answers.text: made changes in the political structure

qas.question: What did the Qing commander do in 1732 and 1728?

context: <b5_0>Qing dynasty<b5_0/> rule in Tibet began with their <a0_0>1720<a0_0/> expedition to the country when they expelled the invading Dzungars. <b6_0>Amdo<b6_0/> came under Qing control in <a1_0>1724<a1_0/>, and eastern Kham <b7_0>was incorporated into neighbouring Chinese provinces<b7_0/> in <a2_0>1728<a2_0/>. Meanwhile, the Qing government sent resident commissioners called Ambans to Lhasa. In 1750 the Ambans and the majority of the Han Chinese and Manchus living in Lhasa were killed <b8_0>in a riot<b8_0/>, and Qing troops arrived quickly and suppressed the rebels in the next year. Like the preceding Yuan dynasty, the Manchus of the Qing dynasty exerted military and administrative control of the region, while granting it a degree of political autonomy. The Qing commander publicly executed a number of supporters of the rebels and, as in 1723 and 1728, <b9_0>made changes in the political structure<b9_0/> and drew up a formal organization plan. The <a3_0>Qing<a3_0/> now restored the Dalai Lama as ruler, leading the governing council called <a4_0>Kashag<a4_0/>, but elevated the role of Ambans to include more direct involvement in Tibetan internal affairs. At the same time the Qing took steps to counterbalance the power of the aristocracy by adding officials recruited from the clergy to key posts.
